heisig_chinese_memo: The night market gets the nickname the fight market because people always stir up trouble there.
Ru_trainchinese: nào: (прил/глаг) шумный; шуметь; беспокоить; давать волю (своим чувствам); болеть, страдать от; подшучивать над; делать, устраивать
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Go through the wrong gate at this shady back alley market and you might just stir up trouble.
humanum_full_description_en:
From " city ", from " fight ", the original meaning is noisy, noisy, and not quiet. "Shuowen Xinfu": "It's not quiet. From the city, fighting." Tang Hanyu, "Tanzhou mooring the boat to the public": "Half sleep at night, the flute is noisy."

" Trouble " can be expressed noisy quarrel. "The Scholars" Chapter 24: "Naturally, the old slave, Stone Mouse, made a noise with the former lady of the Bu family Jia family!"

" Noisy " also means disturbance. Tang Liu Zongyuan's "Answers to Wei Zhongli's Tutor's Book": "Guys who bark have dog ears, and there are a few people who do not bark today, but who dares to dazzle the crowd to provoke anger?"

" Noisy " also means prosperity and prosperity. Tang Yanwu "Inscription on the Nanmu of Guangfu Temple in Bazhou": "The high branches and the noisy leaves and the birds do not stop, half covering the white clouds and evening."

" Noisy " can also mean that (bad things) happen. In the volume of "The King of Wu's Fighting in the Pinghua": "Bigan hits the meat forest in the Jiuchi, and the pagodas pass by the pots. Suddenly there is a whirlwind. It is a waste of life to see it."

" Nao " in modern Chinese can also mean play and play. "Dream of Red Mansions" Chapter 119: "Gambling, drinking, making trouble, and taking the wife from outside to the house, isn't this the master?"
humanum_short_description_en: From the " city ", from the " fight ", the original meaning is noisy, noisy, and not quiet.
humanum_full_description:
從「市」，從「鬥」，本義為喧嘩、嘈雜、不安靜。《說文新附》：「不靜也。从市、鬥。」 唐韓愈〈潭州泊船呈諸公〉：「夜寒眠半覺，鼓笛鬧嘈嘈。」

　　「鬧」可表示吵鬧、爭吵。《儒林外史》第24回：「自然是石老鼠這老奴才把卜家的前頭娘子賈氏撮弄的來鬧了！」

　　「鬧」還表示擾亂。唐柳宗元〈答韋中立論師道書〉：「顧吠者犬耳，度今天下不吠者幾人，而誰敢衒怪於群目以召鬧取怒乎？」

　　「鬧」亦表示繁盛、旺盛。唐嚴武〈題巴州光福寺楠木〉：「高枝鬧葉鳥不度，半掩白雲朝與暮。」

　　「鬧」還能表示發生（不好的事情）。《武王伐紂平話》卷中：「比干打酒池肉林、炮烙蠆盆邊過，忽有旋風鬧起，睹是枉死生靈。」

　　近現代漢語「鬧」還可表示搞、弄。《紅樓夢》第119回：「賭錢喝酒，鬧小旦，還接了外頭的媳婦兒到宅裏來，這不是爺嗎？」
humanum_short_description: 從「市」，從「鬥」，本義為喧嘩、嘈雜、不安靜。

從「 市 」，從「 鬥 」，本義為喧嘩、嘈雜、不安靜。《說文新附》：「不靜也。从市、鬥。」 唐韓愈〈潭州泊船呈諸公〉：「夜寒眠半覺，鼓笛鬧嘈嘈。」 「 鬧 」可表示吵鬧、爭吵。《儒林外史》第24回：「自然是石老鼠這老奴才把卜家的前頭娘子賈氏撮弄的來鬧了！」 「 鬧 」還表示擾亂。唐柳宗元〈答韋中立論師道書〉：「顧吠者犬耳，度今天下不吠者幾人，而誰敢衒怪於群目以召鬧取怒乎？」 「 鬧 」亦表示繁盛、旺盛。唐嚴武〈題巴州光福寺楠木〉：「高枝鬧葉鳥不度，半掩白雲朝與暮。」 「 鬧 」還能表示發生（不好的事情）。《武王伐紂平話》卷中：「比干打酒池肉林、炮烙蠆盆邊過，忽有旋風鬧起，睹是枉死生靈。」 近現代漢語「 鬧 」還可表示搞、弄。《紅樓夢》第119回：「賭錢喝酒，鬧小旦，還接了外頭的媳婦兒到宅裏來，這不是爺嗎？」
From " city", from " fight", the original meaning is noisy, noisy, and not quiet. "Shuowen Xinfu": "It's not quiet. From the city, fighting." Tang Hanyu, "Tanzhou mooring the boat to the public": "Half sleep at night, the flute is noisy." " Trouble" can be expressed noisy quarrel. "The Scholars" Chapter 24: "Naturally, the old slave, Stone Mouse, made a noise with the former lady of the Bu family Jia family!" " Noisy" also means disturbance. Tang Liu Zongyuan's "Answers to Wei Zhongli's Tutor's Book": "Guys who bark have dog ears, and there are a few people who do not bark today, but who dares to dazzle the crowd to provoke anger?" " Noisy" also means prosperity and prosperity. Tang Yanwu "Inscription on the Nanmu of Guangfu Temple in Bazhou": "The high branches and the noisy leaves and the birds do not stop, half covering the white clouds and evening." " Noisy" can also mean that (bad things) happen. In the volume of "The King of Wu's Fighting in the Pinghua": "Bigan hits the meat forest in the Jiuchi, and the pagodas pass by the pots. Suddenly there is a whirlwind. It is a waste of life to see it." " Nao" in modern Chinese can also mean play and play. "Dream of Red Mansions" Chapter 119: "Gambling, drinking, making trouble, and taking the wife from outside to the house, isn't this the master?"

鬧字的基本解释

鬧
nào
见“闹”。

鬧字的汉语字典释义

[①]［nào］
［《廣韻》奴教切，去效，娘。］
“闹1”的繁体字。亦作“閙1”。
(1)喧哗；不静。
(2)争吵；吵闹。
(3)扰乱。
(4)簇聚；攒聚。
(5)繁盛；旺盛。
(6)发生。多用于指不好的事情。
(7)发泄；排泄。
(8)犹搞，干。
(9)杂，不纯。参见“鬧銀”。
(10)用毒药毒。
(11)指有毒的。参见“鬧香”。

鬧字的康熙字典解释

【亥集上】【鬥字部】　鬧； 康熙笔画：15； 页码：页1457第34
【唐韻】奴敎切【集韻】【韻會】女敎切，?音淖。【說文】不靜也。【廣韻】同?。猥也，擾也。【柳宗元·答韋中立論師道書】以召鬧取怒乎。　又【白居易·寄翰林學士詩】貴主冠浮動，親王轡鬧裝。【薛田詩】九苞綰就佳人髻，三鬧裝成子弟韀。今京師有鬧裝帶，合衆寶雜綴而成，故曰鬧裝。　【類篇】或作?。

鬧字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
鬧字的起名意思

暂无。

[①]［nào］
["Guangyun" slave teaches cut, to effect, mother. ]
Traditional characters for "闹1". Also known as "閙1".
(1) Noisy; no silence.
(2) Quarrel; noisy.
(3) Disturbance.
(4) Cluster; gather together.
(5) Prosperous; exuberant.
(6) Occurrence. Used to refer to bad things.
(7) Vent; excretion.
(8) Still doing it, doing it.
(9) Miscellaneous, impure. See "noisy silver".
(10) Poison with poison.
(11) Refers to poisonous. See "Fragrance".
